channel.title: anon-meta-packages changes
channel.description:
For Whonix 14. Some cleanup / improvements.
https://github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages/blob/master/debian/control
* general cleanup, remove some dependencies that are done by individual packages already * avoid installation of packages not useful to have in Qubes-Whonix
Has a chance to introduce regressions, though. We can minimize those by keeping a package list of a new Whonix 13 installation. (`dpkg -l > old_list.txt`) And then comparing after upgrading the package and running `sudo apt-get autoremove`, to see which packages are really gone.
-----
https://github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages/commit/cd23ef486c1f404f9903f2605fdc2b5972c3bd2e https://github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages/commit/242f19d82e5eb84ba8fc0e67807edfc8ac7bea1d https://github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages/commit/07e956a9080aab563468d72ffcba47e6a85ea8ce https://github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages/commit/3f1cf031dabd57f6886c326c22b7113e48370234
Older:
https://github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages/commits/master
-----
The github diff viewer does not look so great. But even if you just read the commit messages, you get an idea what is going on and can intervene if you think something got wrong.
-----
Helpful to follow these changes (replace menu with other package names):
apt-cache show menu
apt-file -F list menu
-----
Not sure it is useful to keep anon-shared-packages-recommended dependency on menu.
----
Related:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Whonix_Debian_Packages

item.title: anon-meta-packages changes

item.description:
For Whonix 14. Some cleanup / improvements.

https://github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages/blob/master/debian/control

  • general cleanup, remove some dependencies that are done by individual packages already
  • avoid installation of packages not useful to have in Qubes-Whonix

Has a chance to introduce regressions, though. We can minimize those by keeping a package list of a new Whonix 13 installation. (dpkg -l > old_list.txt) And then comparing after upgrading the package and running sudo apt-get autoremove, to see which packages are really gone.

github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages

no longer install accessibility tools by default due to issues 

no longer depend on anon-shared-kde-accessibility
https://phabricator.whonix.org/T457

changed 1 files with 0 additions and 2 deletions.

Thanks to entropy for the suggestion!
https://forums.whonix.org/t/no-sound-in-workstation-virtualbox-on-linux-host

changed 1 files with 1 additions and 1 deletions.

because we do not need them in Qubes
poweroff-passwordless (Qubes has passwordless sudo by default https://www.qubes-os.org/doc/vm-sudo/)
power-savings-disable-in-vms (not required)
rads (Qubes uses seamless window...

https://github.com/Whonix/anon-meta-packages/commits/master

The github diff viewer does not look so great. But even if you just read the commit messages, you get an idea what is going on and can intervene if you think something got wrong.

Helpful to follow these changes (replace menu with other package names):

apt-cache show menu

apt-file -F list menu

Not sure it is useful to keep anon-shared-packages-recommended dependency on menu.
